benchmark_details.name: Subpopulation Structure Discovery with Large Language Model (SSD-LLM)
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a novel concept of subpopulation structures to represent, analyze, and utilize subpopulation distributions within datasets. The SSD-LLM framework employs large language models to analyze informative image captions and summarize the structures, facilitating tasks such as dataset subpopulation organization, subpopulation shift, and slice discovery.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic exploration of subpopulation structure discovery and to enable effective downstream applications in subpopulation-related tasks.

data.source: Various image datasets including Waterbirds, Metashift, NICO++
data.annotation: Automatically generated by Large Language Models

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance on subpopulation-related tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values indicate better performance on subpopulation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared to previous methods achieving average +3.3% worst group accuracy gain.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness was validated through experiments on benchmark datasets.
